Post.title: publication head
Post.raw:
--- title: publication head academia: true date: 3023-06-09 19:24:06 tags: ---

Publications

Post.title: about
Post._content:
About

I am a Ph.D. Candidate at Carnegie Mellon University, working with Prof. [Aswin Sankaranarayanan](https://users.ece.cmu.edu/~saswin) and Prof. [Matthew O'toole](https://www.cs.cmu.edu/~motoole2/). My research interests mainly focus on **computational photography**, which jointly solves imaging problems with **computer vision** algorithms and **optical** designs. My past publication includes near-eye **3D displays**, **neural rendering**, **imaging behind scattering media**, and **deep learning**-based domain adaptation, with a total of 2k citations. **I am looking for a full-time position starting from January 2024.**
Post.raw:
--- title: about academia: true date: 4023-06-09 19:24:06 tags: ---

My research interests mainly focus on **computational photography**, which jointly solves imaging problems with **computer vision** algorithms and **optical** designs. My past publication includes near-eye **3D displays**, **neural rendering**, **imaging behind scattering media**, and **deep learning**-based domain adaptation, with a total of 2k citations. **I am looking for a full-time position starting from January 2024.**
Post.content:
About

I am a Ph.D. Candidate at Carnegie Mellon University, working with Prof. Aswin Sankaranarayanan and Prof. Matthew O’toole. My research interests mainly focus on computational photography, which jointly solves imaging problems with computer vision algorithms and optical designs.

My past publication includes near-eye 3D displays, neural rendering, imaging behind scattering media, and deep learning-based domain adaptation, with a total of 2k citations.

I am looking for a full-time position starting from January 2024.

About

I am a Ph.D. Candidate at Carnegie Mellon University, working with Prof. Aswin Sankaranarayanan and Prof. Matthew O’toole. My research interests mainly focus on computational photography, which jointly solves imaging problems with computer vision algorithms and optical designs.

My past publication includes near-eye 3D displays, neural rendering, imaging behind scattering media, and deep learning-based domain adaptation, with a total of 2k citations.

I am looking for a full-time position starting from January 2024.
